title: Is It Okay To Have Feelings For Your Ex? (w/Kootra) - Love & Sex Stuff
description:

Should you cut off all feelings for your exes? 

Each and every Monday at 9AM PST Tim Gettys and Nick Scarpino answer your questions about dating and relationship advice....cause that sounds like a good idea.


Follow us on Twitter!

Music by Tonedeff - http://www.QN5.com

transcript_chunks.text: so dude I'm really excited about this new partnership it's Gonna be great it's perfect I will always love you sorry about that it's kind of weird sometimes so Jordan Nick yes today's question comes from 22-year-old Mike he says hey Nick and Tim I'm Kootra, love the show I've only been in two relationships in my life the first was with my childhood sweetheart who I met in middle school and fell hopelessly in love with class of T after years of pursuing her we finally started a relationship in our final year but nothing lasts forever and as school ended so did we fast forward a few years and I'm now in a 4-year strong relationship with my current partner with a 2-year-old son whom I love to bits we couldn't be happier with each other and are maybe even planning baby number two so despite being in a loving relationship sh I sometimes find myself thinking of my first girlfriend and reminiscing or wondering what she's up to now I tell myself that it's impossible to completely bury

being in a loving relationship, sometimes I find myself thinking of my first girlfriend and reminiscing or wondering what she's up to now. I tell myself that it's impossible to completely bury feelings for someone, but am I being dishonest with my current partner by still harboring these feelings? No, that's what Facebook is for. Am I wrong? No... I look, I think what you're suffering from right now is what we call in the trade as the "grass is always greener on the other side" syndrome. Um, there's always going to be a little bit of wonder because there are always options in life, but what it means to be a man is you have to actually just commit and devote yourself to this relationship, which it sounds like you're doing, which is fantastic. Yeah, I think the best part is that like you're happy, you know? It's not like you're wondering, "Oh, like I'm happy now, and like there's something out there could it be better?" It's like no, I'm happy; I'm just kind of wondering what's

that like you're happy you know it's not like you're wondering oh like I'm happy now and like there's something out there could it be better it's like no I'm happy I'm just kind of wondering what's going on with that and like that's just a curiosity that people have and I think that that makes that makes a lot of sense I think the most important thing is to feel your feelings you know like if you want to if you're curious like cool explore that just you know obviously you need to respect the relationship you're in because that is that's really all that matters if you establish yourself in a current relationship then you know having those feelings isn't unnatural for the for the previous one but you know if you're really feeling like you want to keep that current relationship going you're probably going to have to you know figure something out to you know if you feel like it's the right thing to come clean about it and you know talk about it with your current partner

you're probably going to have to figure something out if you feel like it's the right thing to come clean about it and talk about it with your current girlfriend or wife, it's either that or you just have to put those feelings to rest. yeah exactly I definitely think there's a clear line where it's just like it's acceptable to look at a Facebook page, it's not acceptable to start Facebook messaging, not acceptable to just go get coffee with each other, no draw the line again I'm not saying you're wrong for this, I think you spent a lot of time with this person and at one point this person meant a lot to you so there's absolutely nothing wrong with still having a little bit of love for that person in your life but you have to draw the distinction between how having affection for someone who meant something for you and being with your wife
